answers.answer: I have been diabetic since '96. I would suggest to you to go see your PCP and do what they say. I would not just go off it.

Currently there is no cure for diabetes. One does not stop taking their medication because they feel OK or normal. Stopping or even reducing the amount of insulin inappropriately may cause bodily harm. Talk with your doctor.When fasting 60-80 mg/dl is considered normal although below 70 is getting low. But since you've kept it a secret as to when you measure, type of pills and dosage, or when you take your Lantus its hard to say if your levels are normal. Talk with your doctor."Now it is too down. Should I continue with the insulin now that its controlled?"Huh? Down? Controlled? Please obtain better knowledge and understanding about diabetes type 2 so you can stop guessing. Follow this link http://www.diabetes.org/home.jspBottom line; talk with your doctor.

question: I am a recently diagnosed Adult type II diabetes.  My sugar has been between 60 and 80 for the last couple of days.  I have been taking 35 units of Lantus plus in addition to my diabeties pills.  The reason I started taking the insulin is because my glucose could not be brought down.  Now it is too down. Should I continue with the insulin now that is controlled?
title: Should I continue?
